snippet: Hewlett-Packard’s ill-fated acquisition of the software maker Autonomy will cost another $100 million, as it prepares to settle litigation tied to the 2011 deal.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard will pay $100 million to settle class-action suit tied to its 2011 acquisition of software maker Autonomy, latest setback stemming from ill-fated deal.
lead_paragraph: Hewlett-Packard’s ill-fated acquisition of the software maker Autonomy will cost another $100 million, as it prepares to settle litigation tied to the 2011 deal.

headline.print_headline: HP to Pay $100 Million to Settle Suit Over Autonomy Purchase
headline.main: Hewlett-Packard to Pay $100 Million to Settle Suit Over Autonomy Purchase
